title: How to Make Popcorn Shrimp

parts.name: Creating the Mixture and Preparing to Fry

steps.headline: Take out a medium bowl.
steps.description: Bring together the first three ingredients and mix them well (use a whisk to mix them). Then, take out another bowl and place the bread crumbs in that bowl Incorporate the remainder of the Essence into the mixture and mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Bring out a stockpot.
steps.description: The size should be 128 fluid ounces (which is equal to a gallon).

steps.headline: Pour vegetable oil into the stockpot for frying.
steps.description: Have your stockpot on a temperature of 360 °F (182 °C) prior to heating.

steps.headline: Create a breading for the shrimp.
steps.description:
Bring together approximately a quarter or third of them, and incorporate them into the batter made using the eggs. Make sure that all shrimp have a breading. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c3\/Make-Popcorn-Shrimp-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Popcorn-Shrimp-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c3\/Make-Popcorn-Shrimp-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Popcorn-Shrimp-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Run any extra bread crumbs through a loose sieve.
steps.description: Make sure the bread crumbs go to another bowl (make sure the bowl is not dirty). This process should be completed a total of three times.

steps.headline: Put your shrimp into your stockpot and allow them to cook in hot oil.
steps.description: Do this until they are golden brown, and stir them occasionally.

steps.headline: Once your shrimp are golden brown, get out a spoon that is slotted.
steps.description: Use the spoon to carefully take the shrimp out.

steps.headline: Transfer to the shrimp to a sheet pan that has paper on it.
steps.description: Allow them to cool for a few minutes, and then serve them. Enjoy your meal!

text:
Creating the Mixture and Preparing to Fry Take out a medium bowl. Bring together the first three ingredients and mix them well (use a whisk to mix them). Then, take out another bowl and place the bread crumbs in that bowl Incorporate the remainder of the Essence into the mixture and mix until well-combined. Bring out a stockpot. The size should be 128 fluid ounces (which is equal to a gallon). Pour vegetable oil into the stockpot for frying. Have your stockpot on a temperature of 360 °F (182 °C) prior to heating. Breading the Shrimp Create a breading for the shrimp. Bring together approximately a quarter or third of them, and incorporate them into the batter made using the eggs. Make sure that all shrimp have a breading. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c3\/Make-Popcorn-Shrimp-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Popcorn-Shrimp-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c3\/Make-Popcorn-Shrimp-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Popcorn-Shrimp-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Run any extra bread crumbs through a loose sieve. Make sure the bread crumbs go to another bowl (make sure the bowl is not dirty). This process should be completed a total of three times. Frying the Shrimp Put your shrimp into your stockpot and allow them to cook in hot oil. Do this until they are golden brown, and stir them occasionally. Once your shrimp are golden brown, get out a spoon that is slotted. Use the spoon to carefully take the shrimp out. Transfer to the shrimp to a sheet pan that has paper on it. Allow them to cool for a few minutes, and then serve them. Enjoy your meal! Finished.
